Package be.belgium.eid.exceptions

Enum Summary
CardNotFoundException.CardNotFoundType Contains the types of card not found exception
 

Exception Summary
BufferTooSmallException The "buffer too small" exception indicates that the requested data couldn't be stored in the given buffer since it was too small.
CardNotFoundException The "card not found" exception indicates that the card with which the connection is to be made is not present in the card reader.
EIDException The eID exception concerns any BE ID specific exceptions.
HashVerificationException The "verification hash" exception is thrown when the actual hashcode of a certain object doesn't match the hash that should be generated.
InvalidSWException The "invalid SW" exception indicates that the values 0x90 and 0x00 should have been returned for Status Word (SW) 1 and 2 respectively.
NoReadersFoundException The "no readers found" exception indicates that in the current context (state of the device) there are no readers connected to the system or with that name.
RootVerificationException The "root verification" exception is thrown when the root certificate of a certain smart card couldn't be verified against the hard coded root certificate.
SignatureVerificationException The "signature verification" exception is thrown when certain data couldn't be verified against it's signature using a public key or that the verification turned out to be unsuccessful because of a mismatch between the data and signature.
TagNotFoundException The "tag not found" exception indicates that in a TLV mapping the given tag doesn't exist and as such cannot be used to identify data associated with it.
UnknownErrorException The unknown error exception is thrown when an unknown or unhandled exception was thrown.
WrongPINException The "wrong PIN" exception indicates that the entered PIN was invalid.
